titleInfo.title: Brought to the Second Municipality Police Prison.

mods.abstract: BROUGHT to the Second Municipality Police Prison--JAMES BURDINE, aged about 30 years, 5 feet 9 inches high, has a large scar from the corner of his right eye to the top of his forehead; says he is free and lives in Louisville, Ky., but supposed to be a slaveBETSY, a dark griffe, 5 feet 3 inches high, aged about 35 years, has lost four of her front upper teeth; says she belongs to MrTregon, of the Third MunicipalityGEORGE SHEPHERD, a dark griffe, 5 feet 3 1/2 inches high, aged about 35 years, has small scars under his right eye; says he is free and lives in Lafayette, but supposed to be a slaveMATILDA, a griffe, aged about 29 years, 5 feet 5 inches high, has lost two of her upper front teeth; says she belongs to MrSappeeThe owners will please conform with the law respecting themH.JWILLIAMS, WardenNewOrleans, April 17, 1851ap16 1aw3w
mods.note: James Burdine (30); Betsy (35); George Shepherd (35); Matilda (29)
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU LibrariesCopyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domainPermission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
